title: Rifugio Nino Pernici

images.title: The hut Pernici - Bocca di Trat

texts.short: Pernici Hut is located in the mountains between the Lake Garda and the Ledro Valley, in a wonderful panoramic position at 1600 mt.
texts.long:
Easily reachable from different tracks, here you can find tipical cousine and a bar-service. With its 30 beds in rooms for four or six people, it is a good point to start or to finish some beautiful hikings to discover the amazing peaks and ridges all around.

The tracks bring you to visit charming mountains, an unforgettable trip from the spring blooms to the warm colors of autumn. Nearby there are trenches from the First World War. 

Potato's polenta is the speciality of Rifugio Pernici, accompanied by meat or melted cheese.
texts.gettingThere: From Lenzumo (Val di Ledro) you reach by car the parking space before Malga Trat in about 7 km. Then, you continue on foot along the forestry road for about 30 min.
texts.parking: Free parking before Malga Trat.
texts.businessHours:
Open: daily from middle of April until middle of October.

During Christmas time and in the weekends of January and February.

openTimes.additionalInfo:
Open: daily from middle of April until middle of October.

During Christmas time and in the weekends of January and February.

title: Rifugio San Pietro

images.title: The mountain hut Rifugio San Pietro
View from the little church San Pietro

texts.short: Top views of Lake Garda and typical Trentino dishes: San Pietro mountain hut is the ideal destination for bikers and hikers looking for relaxation in the green
texts.long:
A balcony with unforgettable views of Lake Garda, accessible on foot or by bike, just a few minutes from Lake Tenno. Sport and relaxation for everyone in a family atmosphere with typical Trentino cuisine.

In short, this is San Pietro mountain hut, opened in the 1930s by the Riva del Garda section of the SAT - Association of Trentino Mountaineers, at the point where an old hermitage was located. Next to the mountain hut is the small, still consecrated church of St. Peter, after which the hut is named.

Since its opening, the hut has been one of the most popular hiking destinations in Garda Trentino, also thanks to its accessibility. It is indeed possible to arrive by car about 15 minutes on foot from the hut, which is even accessible with a hiking stroller.

The hut is open all year round. However, it is advisable to contact the manager to inquire about the actual opening, especially out of season.
texts.gettingThere:
From Riva del Garda follow the signs for Tenno / Lago di Tenno. At Ville del Monte turn right at the junction after the church and follow the road that climbs the slopes of Monte Calino, up to the car park (signs for Rifugio San Pietro). From the parking lot to the hut you have to walk for about 15 minutes on an easy dirt road.

Further hiking access routes to the refuge:

  • from Canale di Tenno - path SAT 406 (1h30)
  • from Lake Tenno - path SAT 406A (1h15)
  • from Tenno - path SAT 401 (2h)
texts.parking: Free parking on Monte Calino
texts.businessHours: San Pietro mountain hut is open all year round. It is nevertheless advisable to contact the manager to inquire about the actual opening, especially out of season.

openTimes.additionalInfo: San Pietro mountain hut is open all year round. It is nevertheless advisable to contact the manager to inquire about the actual opening, especially out of season.

teaserText: A balcony with unforgettable views of Lake Garda, accessible on foot or by bike, just a few minutes from Lake Tenno. Sport and relaxation for ever...

title: CONTRIN

texts.long:
Built at the end of the 19th century by the Nuremberg Alpenverein, many know it as the mountaineers’ refuge, but a hundred years ago - in September 1915, during the Great War - this mountain chalet was occupied by the Austrian army. The Alpine troops destroyed the building with a mortar, but it was the same “Black Feathers” who inaugurated it around 10 years later, after receiving it as a gift from the State and from SAT and after having rebuilt it exactly where it was. Now the Rifugio Contrin - one of the most welcoming in the Dolomites - is still an important refuge for the Alpine troops, but, above all, in the summer it’s a destination for many walkers who make their way up from the Valle di Fassa and a base for climbers wanting to traverse the summits of the Marmolada Group. Open From mid-June to late September Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the opening of the mountain hut Walks From the Refuge you can climb to the top of the Marmolada (Punta Penia) along the via ferrata on the west ridge (climbing route from Forcella Marmolada - 4 hours, difficulty EEA). Heading instead up and over Passo Ombretta, you can get to Rifugio Falier at the foot of the south face of the Marmolada (2 ½ hours, difficulty EE). Other possible walks are to Rifugio Fuchiade (across Passo delle Cirelle - 3 hours, difficulty E). For anyone with more modest ambitions, the short walk from the refuge to nearby Malga Contrin is a must.

SUITABILITY
groups, non-smokers, children, business travelers, families, young persons, singles

PAYMENT METHODS
cash payment, credit cards accepted, EC-Cash/Maestro

LOCATION
meadowlands, mountain location, on the hiking path, green area, near the forest, quiet location

INCIDENTAL COSTS
use of washing machine/dryer

FACILITIES / SERVICES
panorama restaurant, terrace/garden restaurant, restaurant, bar

BEDS & ROOMS
multi-bed room/s, double room/s, bed / s

MEALS
à la carte restaurant

FOREIGN LANGUAGES
English, German
texts.gettingThere: The refuge is less than 6 km from the village of Alba di Canazei, and can be reached on foot along a dirt road. As a result, countless tourists staying in the surrounding valleys make this a day trip. From Alba di Canazei (car park at the Ciampac cable car station) take the dirt road (SAT no. 602), which passes Baita Locia Contrin, 1736 m, and Rifugio Mèlga Cianci (2 hours, difficulty E)

address.town: SAN GIOVANNI DI FASSA - SÈN JAN POZZA DI FASSA - POZA IT

title: CEVEDALE "GUIDO LARCHER"

images.title: Ambiente tipico e confortevole al Rifugio Larcher
Panorama dal Rifugio Larcher Cevedale sul Vioz
Rifugio Larcher Cevedale sotto la neve
Sala da pranza, Rifugio Larcher Cevedale
Cima Nera, Val di Sole, Trentino

texts.long:
If your ambition is to climb Cevedale, or if you are simply content to admire it from below, this is the place for you: the Rifugio Cevedale Guido Larcher is situated on a rock terrace at the foot of the highest peak in Trentino (on the border with Lombardy and South Tyrol) in a majestic and impressive environment, especially if you aren’t used to high mountains. We are in the Stelvio National Park, where you can easily come into contact with the wildlife. If you want to marvel at the splendour of the Mare glacier, you can also walk up to this refuge (opened in the 1990s on the site of an older building) in spring, when it is sometimes open for ski mountaineers. Open From 20 June to 20 September From mid-March to mid-April Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks To climb Cevedale across the Mare glacier requires mountaineering experience and involves a 4-hour walk over the glacier. Within the capabilities of any walker, instead, is the route from the refuge to the valley that first ascends to the Lago della Marmotta, then continues to the Malga Mare car park via Lake Careser (2 hours, difficulty E).

GROUPS
groups possible with max. pers.

BEDS & ROOMS
double room/s, bed / s

FOREIGN LANGUAGES
English, German

LOCATION
quiet location, green area, on the hiking path, mountain location

FACILITIES / SERVICES
to be reached on foot only
texts.gettingThere: From Cogolo in Val di Peio by car along an asphalt road (9km) to the Malga Mare power station (car park), then on foot on SAT path 102 (1 ¾ hours, difficulty E).

address.town: PEIO VAL VENEZIA - MALGA MARE IT

title: RIFUGIO MONTE BALDO

texts.long:
On the flower-covered slopes of Monte Baldo between Monte Telegrafo and Monte Altissimo, is the Rifugio Monte Baldo, built in 1924 near the shrine of Madonna delle Nevi (Our Lady of the Snows), a place of pilgrimage built in the sixteenth century. A small playground outside the refuge will keep the children happy while their parents can enjoy the local Trentino cuisine and the peaceful environment of the Val Domenegal, where animals graze on the gentle slopes on the border between Trentino and the Veneto. Open From late Mach to mid-November Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks From the refuge it’s a 4 ½ hour walk to the Rifugio Monte Telegrafo, overlooking Lake Garda. A circular route of five hours (starting and finishing at the refuge) give you the opportunity to have a go at the (moderately difficult) Gerardo Sega via ferrata on the rock face of Monte Coalaz, standing out, unexpected, amid the vegetation.

texts.gettingThere: By car: * A22, exit AFFI: Take the SP direction Caprino Veronese, follow the signs to Ferrara di Monte Baldo, drive along the road SP n ° 3 “Graziani” in direction Pra Alpesina. At the junction turn right on the road No. 230, keep right. * A22-ALA AVIO exit: keep left and drive to Avio. In Avio, take the road SP 11 to continue towards S. Valentino. After approximately 11 km turn in direction Pra Alpesina. After about 9 km turn left and follow the signs "Rifugio Monte Baldo". * A22, exit Rovereto South: Take the road to Mori, continue for about 3 km towards Riva del Garda. Follow the signs for Brentonico. Turn left to the dike "Pra da Stua". Immediately after turn right to Pra Alpesina. After about 9 km you reach a junction to the left with signs "Rifugio Monte Baldo". By train: It is possible to arrive by train in Avio or Ala, then take by public transport (bus) to arrive in the village of Gorghi. Then walk along Valle dei Molini and follow the path to Madonna della Neve. Travel time from Avio to Madonna della Neve: 2 hours and 45 minutes.

title: ROSETTA "GIOVANNI PEDROTTI"

texts.long:
Welcome to the kingdom of rock. The Rifugio Rosetta Giovanni Pedrotti is where the Altopiano delle Pale di San Martino begins. The walk up from the valley (1,000 metres below) may be demanding, but it’s just a quarter of an hour on foot to the refuge from top station of the cable car. If you need a reason to go there, here are three: to marvel at the Fradusta glacier with its little lake (before it's too late); to find out how cold it can get in the winter in the dolines where Italy’s lowest ever temperature was recorded; or to put on your hiking boots (in summer) or snowshoes (in winter) and venture into places where the Earth looks more like the Moon. This is where mountaineer Mariano Lott - the warden - has set up base camp with his wife Roberta. And don’t forget to make a cairn, like the ones that mark the way here. Open Every day from 20 June to late September Every day from 26 December to 6 January, then only at weekends until Easter Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks From the Rifugio Rosetta a network of high-altitude paths crosses the Altopiano delle Pale di San Martino taking you to the peaks and the other refuges in the group. One option well within the ability of everyone is the ascent of Cima Rosetta, which takes about ½ hour from the top station of the cable car and rewards with a spectacular view of San Martino di Castrozza. When the weather is good, it’s an easy walk to the Fradusta glacier and lake and to Lake Manna (4 hours, difficulty EE) in an area known as the “Riviera”, a reminder of the marine origins of these coral mountains. The Refuge is also the start of the Giro della Pala, a fascinating walk without any particular technical difficulties across the entire mountain chain from north to south (5 hours, difficulty EE).

title: ORSO BRUNO

texts.long:
Near Monte Vigo with views of the peaks of Cevedale (to the north) and the Brenta Group (to the south) is where you’ll find the Rifugio Orso Bruno, built in the early seventies at 2,156 metres above sea level. With all amenities, the refuge in winter is at the centre of the Skirama Dolomiti ski area, a focal point linking Marilleva, Folgarida and Madonna di Campiglio. In summer, on the other hand, when the ski lifts also run, it is frequented by families who appreciate the sweeping vistas, the local cuisine and the opportunities for moderate walks. Open From 20 June to 20 September From early December to early April Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks A roughly 40-minute (downhill) walk takes you to Lago delle Malghette and the refuge of the same name. From the lake you can walk down to Folgarida through the forested Val Meledrio passing the Malga di Vigo and Malga di Folgarida summer pastures (2 ½ hours to the valley floor, difficulty E). The walk over Passo della Pesa then down to the little Mezzana lakes and to the Malga Copai takes 1 hour (difficulty E).

title: GARDECCIA

images.title: Gardeccia hut - Pozza di Fassa - Val di Fassa

texts.long:
A historic retreat in the heart of the Dolomites that, for over 100 years, has offered a starting point for numerous walks and climbs into an enchanting landscape. Beyond lies a succession of meadows, forests and majestic crags to explore with easy walks for the whole family, protected “Vie Ferrate” climbing routes for more excitement, and classic or modern climbs for all difficulty levels. The Catinaccio – “Rosengarten” in German – is one of nine mountain groups with UNESCO World Heritage Site recognition of its landscape and geological value. With easy access via a bus service from Pozza di Fassa, you can spend a few relaxing days far from cars and, in peace and tranquillity, enjoy a view that is the envy of all. Being able go to sleep with views of the alpenglow forming a picture perfect sunset is priceless, not to mention being able to wake up and set straight off the next day. In addition to overnight accommodation, the mountain hut offers a café and restaurant service, Wi-Fi in the public areas and a small library for rainy days.

title: AL FAGGIO

texts.long:
In the midst of the dense, pristine forests of the Val Concei, the Rifugio al Faggio is named after a large beech tree (faggio is Italian for beech) that stands behind the refuge, estimated to be over 250 years old. Built in 1955, the refuge has been updated over the years and is now frequented by lovers of good food and relaxation (there’s even a swimming pool). Mountain devotees still find plenty to get their teeth into on the Alpi di Ledro, whose slopes and peaks were of great strategic importance during the Great War. Open All year round Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks It’s an easy 2 ¾ hour walk up to Bocca dell'Ussòl, the head of the Val Concei. It takes 4 hours to get to the panoramic peak of Monte Carida, the highest mountain in the Alpi di Ledro (difficulty E). The walk to the Rifugio Nino Pernici Bocca di Trat can be done in about 3 hours (difficulty E).

texts.long:
There are at least three (good) reasons to go up the Valle di Fassa to Gardeccia on foot, by bicycle or by the lifts: to spread a blanket on the grass and watch the children play, to stroll along a few easy footpaths, or to shoulder your rucksack and head up to the Catinaccio’s rock faces. Whatever takes your fancy, the Stella Alpina Spiz Piaz Rifugio, on your left as you walk up towards the Valle del Vajolet - an area much loved and frequented by tourists - was built in this valley basin as far back as the late 19th century. Originally just a barn with a hayloft, it has been enlarged several times until the last re-structuring in 2011. Open From mid-May to mid-October From late December to Easter Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks From Gardeccia it’s an easy 45-minute walk up to the Vallon del Vajolet refuges (Vaiolet and Paul Preuss), where all sorts of opportunities open up for mountaineering or walking in the Catinaccio. The Rifugio Ciampedìe is a 40-minute walk in the opposite direction to Gardeccia, on an equally easy and less steep path.

title: PRADIDALI

texts.long:
If you walk up the Valle Pradidali in late spring you’ll see mountain poppies springing up in the scree and you’ll understand the reason for its name: Pradidali means “yellow meadows”. But where the tufts of grass become increasingly sparse and give way to rock, there you’ll find the refuge, gateway to the Pale di San Martino from the southern side. The towers surrounding the refuge - also of stone, built in 1896 at a height of 2,278 metres - have tested the toughest climbers in the Dolomites, those of the past and of the modern era, such as Manolo, who is at home surrounded by these walls. Before returning to the valley (or continuing to the Altopiano delle Pale), make sure you visit the little lake and take a look at Cima Canali, a rock cathedral that can only be seen from there. Duilio and Luca Boninsegna (father and son, both mountain guides) run the refuge with essential help from Piera, the refuge’s cook and the only female member of the Boninsegna family. Open From 20 June to late September On weekends in autumn Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks From the refuge it’s a 2 hour 20 minute walk to Rifugio Rosetta Giovanni Pedrotti via Passo Pradidali (experienced walkers); it takes around 3 ½ hours to walk to the Rifugio Velo della Madonna on the demanding Porton and del Velo via ferratas; you can also get to the Rifugio Treviso in Val Canali via Passo delle Lede and the Minazio bivouac hut in 4 hours (experienced walkers). The Rifugio Pradidali can also be the start (or a stopover) of the spectacular Pala Ronda Trek, a circular route around the Pala di San Martino (passing the Rifugio Rosetta), which can be done in either one or two days.

Pedrotti alla Rosetta, then continue for a stretch on footpath no. 707 then no. 709 and when you get to Passo di Pradidali Basso walk down a wide valley to the refuge (2 ½ hours, difficulty E). From San Martino di Castrozza it’s a roughly 3-hour walk on the famous Barone Von Lesser path, the final part of which is a 200m stretch of protected path followed by the descent to the refuge from Passo di Ball (difficulty EE).

title: RIFUGIO CEREDA

texts.long:
The refuge is located on the Passo Cereda road, which runs through flowery meadows between Trentino and the Province of Belluno, and for more than sixty years has been welcoming travellers and walkers following the Alta Via number 2 from Bressanone to Feltre. Even if you’ve come up here simply to try their typical Trentino dishes, the (easy) walk along the road to Malga Fossetta is a must(when you get there you'll see why), where you’ll have a wonderful view of the Piz de Sagron rising out of lush green meadows. Open The refuge is open throughout the year; in the low season it’s advisable to call us for confirmation. Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks From Passo Cereda go down the main road towards Primiero until you meet the path for Villa Welsperg in Val Canali, headquarters of the Paneveggio and Pale di San Martino Nature Park(1 ½ hours, difficulty E). The walk to Rifugio Treviso in Val Canali, on the other hand, is very long (5 hours, difficulty EE). Equally interesting is the path to the village of Sagron passing through ancient pine forests and over the screes beneath the Piz Sagron massif.

title: CASTIGLIONI MARMOLADA

texts.long:
Built in the early 20th century by Bavarian mountaineers from Bamberg, the Rifugio Castiglioni Marmolada was bombed during World War II and then rebuilt in the thirties by the Milan branch of CAI (Italian Mountaineering Club). The refuge is dedicated to mountaineer Ettore Castiglioni and its dining room windows afford a magnificent view of the Marmolada, Queen of the Dolomites, its north side covered by the glacier whose meltwaters flow into Lake Fedaia in summer. The decor (carefully maintained over the years) evokes a mountain atmosphere of times gone by. The refuge is owned by the Soraruf family, who also own the Capanna Punta Penia, the highest refuge in the Dolomites on top of the Marmolada. Open From early May to early November From Christmas to 10 January From late January to Easter Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks From Passo Fedaia it’s possible to undertake the ascent of Punta Penia (summit of the Marmolada) along the normal route over the glacier. The route requires mountaineering skills and you should be accompanied by a mountain guide (1 ½ hours to Pian dei Fiacconi plus 3 ½ hours on the normal route to Punta Penia; the route can be shortened by taking the ski lift up to Pian dei Fiacconi). The Marmolada can also be climbed by the (difficult) West Ridge via ferrata (3 ½ hours) which begins at Forcella Marmolada (where you can also descend to Rifugio Contrin). On the side of the valley opposite the Marmolada, the Rifugio Viel Dal Pan can be reached in 1 ¾ hours, or you can climb the via ferrata delle Trincee from Porta Vescovo to Passo Padon with magnificent views across the glacier (3 hours, medium difficulty).

title: RIFUGIO TRIVENA

texts.long:
The Rifugio Trivena is located in Val di Breguzzo where the trees are sparse and vast grazing land opens to the view. The original building, an old structure for the workers of a marble quarry, was restored on 1987. The manager, Dario Antonini, is there to welcome the many skiers also during the winter months to share with them the secrets of this wild valley in the Adamello range.  Off the dining room there is a small museum exhibiting relics from WWI. The hotel is open from December 27 to the end of March and from the middle of June to the end of September. For the rest of the year services are available only by reservation for groups of min 20 people. Before setting out for your excursion please check with the manager that the lodge is open. Itineraries: 1 hour’s walk from the lodge to the Piana di Redònt with its impressive waterfalls cascading from the ice smoothed rocks; 3 hours’ walk to the Porte di Danerba (difficulty: EE -experienced hikers) from which it is possible to descend to Val Daone (2h15min walk – difficulty: E – hikers) or to Val di Fumo through the Passo di Breguzzo (2h30min walk – difficulty EE -experienced hikers).

images.title: Benessere al Sores nella zona relax e tisane

texts.long:
The Rifugio Sores is family-friendly tourist refuge with all facilities located on the Predaia plateau. Visitors who love nature will find easy, tranquil paths, but also outdoor games, and an adventure park (the Sorespark) where they can experience the sensation of leaping into the void and test their sense of balance and head for heights. The Refuge, which is open all year round, also has a spa, where guests can enjoy a sauna and an open-air Jacuzzi. Open All year round Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks From Rifugio Sores it takes just 30 minutes to walk to the Rifugio Predaia (which is also accessible by car), and from there you can walk to the Corno di Tres, a fantastic viewpoint over the Adige Valley and numerous peaks in Trentino (2 hours, difficulty E) or to the Malga Nuova di Coredo (1 hour, difficulty E).

Finding us is very simple, we are about half an hour drive from the exit Trento Nord of the motorway A22. Follow the signs for Val di Non- Val di Sole. Reaching the village of Mollaro at the center MELINDA, exit the man road and follow the sign for the PREDAIA ALTOPIANO (plateau). We are about 2 Km above the village of Vervò. The road up to the plateau is served for snowplow, then it is always praticable. We inform you, in winter on the roads of Trentino, it is required by law to have snow tires or chains on board, otherwise heavy fines.

title: RODA DI VAEL

texts.long:
There was once an Austrian gentleman who believed in tourism in the Dolomites, when there were still no roads. It was this man, Theodor Christommannos, who at the beginning of the 20th century conceived the idea of the Dolomites road, and was among the first to believe in the Rifugio Roda di Vael, on the south side of the Catinaccio Group. That was a hundred years ago and if you come up from Carezza you’ll find a statue dedicated to Christomannos on the path, and then this refuge with its (beautiful) wooden-shingled exterior. Roberta Silva is the passionate, imaginative warden of this refuge, taking over from her husband (and mountain guide) Bruno Deluca. Members Cai – DAV – OeAV: discounts are visible on the site of the refuge. The price reductions will be calculated directly on site. The refuge can only be reached on foot. Open From 28 May to 9 October; before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut.

title: CIMA D'ASTA "OTTONE BRENTARI"

texts.long:
At the foot of the highest peak in the Lagorai and on the edge of one of the deepest mountain lakes in Europe, is where the SAT (Association of Trentino Mountaineers) built the Rifugio Cima d'Asta Ottone Brentari in the early years of the 20th century. It was the first (and for many years the only) refuge in this mountain range, the largest in Trentino. Restored twice after damage suffered during the two world wars, the building was enlarged by the SAT in 1985 to meet the demands of increasing numbers of walkers. This is the ideal base for ascending Cima d'Asta, but the clear turquoise waters of the lake alone merit the visit. Open From 20 June to 20 September Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks From the refuge you can climb to the summit of Cima d'Asta via La Forcelletta, an ascent with a section of metal cable that takes 1 ¼ hours (difficulty EE). Instead the walk through Val Sorgazza for Campagnassa via Forcella del Passetto and Monte Coston takes 3 ½ hours (difficulty EE).

title: FRIEDRICH AUGUST

texts.long:
The mountain refuge rises below the Trentino side of the Sassolungo Group. We have 12 beds in comfortable rooms with private bathroom and equipped with all comforts. Additional 30 beds are available in typical Tyrolean rooms with shared bathroom. The refuge has boot warmers, clothes dryer and e-bike recharging point with the possibility to put the bikes indoors, a modern ski-raum and a private ski-lift that takes you directly to the Dolomiti Superski slopes (12 locations and 1200km of slopes) and the famous Sellaronda without cold morning queues. Our cuisine is typical with a touch of modernity, many dishes offered come from our organic farms in Highlander, the largest in Italy. Position: in winter on the SellaRonda; in summer on the Friedrich August Weg path 2300m. Access: from Campitello di Fassa via the Col Rodella cable car, then descending for 10 minutes along the path that leads to Sasso Piatto or from Passo Sella taking the Friedrich August path in 30 minutes you arrive at the refuge. Recommended routes: from the refuge it is possible to undertake the classic paths around the Sassolungo and Sella Group, the attacks of the Col Rodella ferratas, the Oskar Schuster ferrata and the Mesules ferrata are just a few minutes from the refuge. opening: winter: open from early December to early April summer: open from early June to mid-October

title: BAITA CUZ

images.title: Hut Baita Cuz - Pozza di Fassa - Val di Fassa - Winter

texts.long:
If you want to spend a night in the mountains without sacrificing comfort, this is the refuge for you: the wardens have installed a Finnish sauna out on the terrace with its wonderful views. The Rifugio Baita Cuz is a very recent construction and in winter skiers can clip on their skis right outside the door and (from December 2015) make their way directly to the Sella Ronda via Val Jumela and Ciampac. Weather permitting, guests can enjoy our Ladin cuisine on the large terrace, the perfect place to sit and wait for the sun to set behind the Catinaccio/Rosengarten. Open From 20 June to 20 September Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks The walk to Conca del Ciampac via Valle Jumela and Sella Brunec takes 2 ½ hours (difficulty EE). The Rifugio Passo San Nicolò can be reached from Sella Brunec following the Lino Pederiva protected path (it has a short, easy stretch with metal cable). Near the Baita Cuz is the end of the (difficult) “I magnifici 4” via ferrata, dedicated to the mountain rescue volunteers swept away by an avalanche in December 2009 during a rescue attempt (4 hours, difficulty EEA TD - very difficult).

title: VELO DELLA MADONNA

texts.long:
Below Cima della Madonna, this is the most recent refuge to be built from scratch by the SAT (Association of Trentino Mountaineers). Inaugurated in September 1980, it gets its name from the Spigolo del Velo, one of the finest classic climbs in the Dolomites: a 440-metre route, first climbed in 1920 and still attracting (skilled) climbers from around the world. Not far away, on the other side of Cima Cimerlo, in one of the remotest corners of the Pale di San Martino, is the protected path dedicated to Dino Buzzati, journalist (and writer) from Belluno who loved the Pale di San Martino more than any other Dolomitic group. Open From mid-June to late September Before leaving for your hike, always contact the manager to verify the actual opening of the mountain hut Walks It takes 4 hours to get to the Rifugio Rosetta Giovanni Pedrotti on the Nico Gusela via ferrata via Passo di Ball. The Rifugio Pradidali can be reached on the Velo and Porton via ferratas in 3 hours. The ascent of Cima Stanga is not particularly difficult (30 minutes), and it takes 1 ¼ hours to get to Cima Cimerlo on the Buzzati Path.

From Malga Civertaghe, which can be reached from the Primiero to San Martino di Castrozza road, on foot on a forest road, in part asphalted, and then on SAT protected path 713 (2 ¾ hours, difficulty E) From Prati Fosne take the Camillo De Paoli Path, a spectacular route with a short, easy stretch of via ferrata - signposted 734 and 713 - 3 ¼ hours, difficulty E.

title: MARIA E ALBERTO AI BRENTEI

images.title: Rifugio Maria e Alberto ai Brentei
Rifugio Maria e Alberto ai Brentei 1
Rifugio Maria e Alberto ai Brentei 2
Rifugio Maria e Alberto ai Brentei 3

texts.long:
This refuge was for a long time the home of Bruno Detassis, custodian of the Brenta, famous Trentino mountaineer and great humanitarian, who opened hundreds of routes and also contributed to the construction of the Via delle Bocchette. In the middle of the upper Val Brenta, the refuge is on the natural route across this dolomitic group. Inside, black and white photos hanging on the wooden walls tell the story of these places, while outside, a little higher up, a little stone church commemorates those who lost their lives in the mountains. Easily reached by families, the refuge is one of the most famous, popular and well-loved in the entire dolomitic Group. Open June 20 - September 20. Open only with restaurant-bar service Walks The walk up to Bocca di Brenta takes 1 ½ hours and does not present any particular difficulties (difficulty EE). From here it’s a short walk to the Tosa and T. Pedrotti refuges, or you can embark on the Via delle Bocchette, a via ferrata that traverses the entire Brenta Group to Passo Grostè. The walk up to the Rifugio Alimonta takes 1 ½ hours without particular difficulty; much more challenging is the route to the Rifugio Dodici Apostoli “Fratelli Garbari” on the Martinazzi protected path (3 hours - EEA). To get to the Rifugio F.F. Tuckett e Q. Sella take the Bogani path via the Sella del Fridolin, with a stretch through the distinctive “tunnel” cut into the rock (1 ½ hours, difficulty EE).

texts.short: On the slopes of Paganella.
texts.long:
The hut is 1.792 m. and on many trails of Dolomiti Paganella Bike; you can reach it from both Andalo and Fai della Paganella and the hut is just some minutes away from the arrival of the cableway Andalo - Doss Pelà. Traditional cuisine, e-bike charger, bike depot. Possibility of overnight staying.

In Winter, the hut is easy accessible from the slopes of the Ski Area Paganella.
texts.publicTransit: Trentino Trasporti - line 611; from Andalo town centre you get to Doss Pelà using the cableway, the hut is then just 20 minutes away.

texts.parking: Parking place at the departure of the lifts Andalo - Doss Pelà - cima Paganella.

title: Rifugio Capanna Grassi

images.title: The meadows next to Malga Grassi

texts.short: Refuge Capanna Grassi is located close to Malga Grassi, a place used since the past by the cattles because of the rich pastures.
texts.long:
You can reach Capanna Grassi by car, a few kilometres after the little village of Campi, by bike and on foot. It is a best known place among food lovers, that find here genuine food like polenta with meat and other specialties.

On the way to Capanna Grassi, you can find the archeological site of San Martino.
texts.gettingThere: From Riva del Garda take the SP 37 direction Pranzo, then turn to Campi and Malga Grassi

texts.long: Hut Croz dell'Altissimo is 1480m. and it is in the very heart of the Brenta Dolomites, just below the peak Croz dell'Altissimo. From the hut, you can enjoy the most beautiful hikes of the Brenta Dolomites, UNESCO heritage. You can also sleep at the hut and enjoy the typical cuisine.
texts.publicTransit: Trentino Trasporti - line 611, from Trento to Mezzolombardo by train, from Mezzolombardo to Molveno by bus. You catch the cableway from the town centre and then you get to the hut on foot.

At the exit of the long tunnel, near the village of Mezzolombardo, we turn right on the SP 64, direction Fai della Paganella - Andalo - Molveno. You catch the cableway from the town centre and then you get to the hut on foot.

texts.long: Hut Dosso Larici is located wonderful for both the Summer and the Winter season; the slopes of the Paganella Ski Area and the hiking trails going to Cima Paganella are namely just at the hut's door. Typical cuisine and overnight possibilty. 360° view on whole Trentino and on the Brenta Dolomites.
texts.publicTransit: Trentino Trasporti - line 611: from Trento to Mezzolombardo by train, from Mezzolombardo to Fai della Paganella by bus. From Fai della Paganella/Santel you reach the hut by using the charilift.
texts.gettingThere: From the motorway exit Trento nord we drive direction val di Non and Altopiano della Paganella; just afer the long tunnel by Mezzolombardo, we turn right (SP 64), to Fai della Paganella. From Fai della Paganella/Santel you reach the hut by using the charilift.
texts.parking: In the town centre and at the departure of the chairlift to cima Paganella.

texts.short: The heart of Brenta Dolomites
texts.long: Hut Croz dell'Altissimo is 1480m. and it is in the very heart of the Brenta Dolomites, just below the peak Croz dell'Altissimo. From the hut, you can enjoy the most beautiful hikes of the Brenta Dolomites, UNESCO heritage. You can also sleep at the hut and enjoy the typical cuisine.
texts.publicTransit: Trentino Trasporti - line 611, from Trento to Mezzolombardo by train, from Mezzolombardo to Molveno by bus. You catch the cableway from the town centre and then you get to the hut on foot.
texts.gettingThere: Motorway exit Trento nord, then direction Val di Non and Altopiano della Paganella. At the exit of the long tunnel, near the village of Mezzolombardo, we turn right on the SP 64, direction Fai della Paganella - Andalo - Molveno. You catch the cableway from the town centre and then you get to the hut on foot.
texts.parking: Departure of the cableway.

title: Rifugio Malga San Giovanni

texts.short: Malga San Giovanni is the ideal place to enjoy typical food, while enjoying the view over Lake Garda.
texts.long: After the climb by bike or on foot, here you can taste the regional food prepared by the Chef Stefano with high quality products. Some of the plates are lasagne, spinat gnocchi, polenta, deer or rabbit meat, strudel....
texts.gettingThere: Malga San Giovanni is located in Loc. San Giovanni, about 10 km from Arco. You can reach it with an asphalt road passing the little villages of Padaro and Mandrea
texts.parking: Parking space by Malga San Giovanni

texts.short: On the meadows of Paganella
texts.long:
Recently renewed, the hut is very close to the arrival of the cableway Andalo - Doss Pelà (1822 mt.); in the Winter you can reach it from the slopes Salare and Conca d'Argento, in the Summer it is surrounded by green meadows. It is an official Dolomiti Paganella Bike Chalet and from the hut you can enjoy wonderful views on the Brenta Dolomites and on Val di Non.

Terrace, typical Trentino cuisine and three rooms for overnight stayings.
texts.publicTransit: Trentino Trasporti - line 611; from Andalo town centre you get to Doss Pelà using the cableway, the hut is then just 20 minutes away.
texts.gettingThere: From the motorway exit Trento nord we drive direction val di Non and Altopiano della Paganella; just afer the long tunnel by Mezzolombardo, we turn right (SP 64), to Fai della Paganella and Andalo.
texts.parking: Parking place at the departure of the lifts Andalo - Doss Pelà - cima Paganella.

texts.short: The mountain view theatre.
texts.long: The "La Montanara" Refugio is located on the Altopiano del Pradel in the Paganella-Brenta Dolomites, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. A little piece of heaven where you can spend relaxing moments, savouring dishes that combine tradition and innovation. The Sartori family welcomed their first guest back in 1973, and little has changed since then. Life in the Rifugio follows nature's rhythms. Meals are homemade using seasonal, fresh and local produce. People come to this enchanting place to relax, get away from stress, and enjoy the silence that only the mountain can give. Over the years we have refurbished our surroundings to meet the needs of all our visitors, without ruining the genuine spirit and atmosphere that have always made us stand out. As you can tell, the Rifugio, the Altopiano della Paganella and the Brenta Dolomites are part of us, our history and our values. We look forward to giving you a warm welcome!
texts.publicTransit: Trentino Trasporti - linea 611: from Trento to Mezzolombardo by train, from Mezzolombardo to Molveno by bus. You can reach the hut using the lifts from Molveno town centre.
texts.gettingThere: Motorway exit Trento nord, then direction Val di Non and Altopiano della Paganella. At the exit of the long tunnel, near the village of Mezzolombardo, we turn right on the SP 64, direction Fai della Paganella - Andalo - Molveno.
texts.parking: Departure of the lifts to Pradel.
texts.businessHours: Mid March - mid October; mid December - mid January.

openTimes.additionalInfo: Mid March - mid October; mid December - mid January.
